segments.content: Written by
Patrick Melton & Marcus Dunston
Revised Draft

The white sun beats down on the rocky terrain. There's not a 

               cloud in the blue sky and the wind is at a standstill.

               Far in the distance, a MEDIUM SIZED FLAT-BED TRUCK makes its 

               way to the entrance of a large cavern opening. Two VULTURES 

               perched on a barren tree watch the intruders.

The truck screeches to a dusty stop. Three men in matching 

               coveralls and hard hats jump from the cab: CHIEF (42, stocky, 

               weary), LANKY (32, withered) and COLLEGE BOY (23, clean cut 

               and naive).

               Chief holds a map and glares into the howling black mouth 

               before them.
This is it.
Why did it have to be these caves...
Is something wrong?
(to College Boy)
Chief grabs a flashlight and moves to the back of the truck. The logo on the rear gate reads "WIGWAM WASTE MANAGEMENT."

character.name: Don't mind me, buddy. It's nothin'.

dialogue.text: Chief grabs a flashlight and moves to the back of the truck. The logo on the rear gate reads "WIGWAM WASTE MANAGEMENT."

segments.content: The gate drops revealing their full load of YELLOW BARRELS bearing the familiar BIOHAZARD WASTE symbol. INT. CAVERN -- MOMENTS LATER College Boy and Lanky steer a cart loaded with the first barrel inside. Chief's lone beam of light leads the men.

dialogue.text: The gate drops revealing their full load of YELLOW BARRELS bearing the familiar BIOHAZARD WASTE symbol. INT. CAVERN -- MOMENTS LATER College Boy and Lanky steer a cart loaded with the first barrel inside. Chief's lone beam of light leads the men.

segments.content: What's with the awkward silence?
College Boy shakes his head "no" and they set the cart down.

dialogue.text: College Boy shakes his head "no" and they set the cart down.

segments.content: Last winter, a man kidnapped a little
girl and holed up in one of these
caves. The cops had him pinned down
and began to move in. This guy started
shooting... but he wasn't aiming at
the officers...
(getting closer)
...he was firing at something inside.
College Boy is rapt.
When the dust cleared, all they found
was the little girl's shoes.
(beat)
Something GRABS College Boy's ankles, causing him to jump.

dialogue.text: Something GRABS College Boy's ankles, causing him to jump.

segments.content: Lanky's on his knees, having grabbed him from behind. The two men mockingly laugh. College boy settles, embarrassed.

dialogue.text: Lanky's on his knees, having grabbed him from behind. The two men mockingly laugh. College boy settles, embarrassed.

segments.content: Assholes.
Hey, relax, I nearly shit myself
when my boss pulled that one on me.
Then, a sound. All eyes turn.

dialogue.text: Then, a sound. All eyes turn.

segments.content: What was that?
Once was plenty, fellas.

As Chief moves forward, pulling out his pick-axe. Instantly, the cave is illuminated by a white floodlight. A group of GREENPEACE HIPPIE ACTIVISTS stand in the cave, CHAINED TOGETHER at the waist, startling the men into screams. MEAN GREEN (35, crooked glasses on a face that has launched a thousand craps) barks into a MINI BULLHORN that hangs around her neck. She charges towards Chief.

dialogue.text: As Chief moves forward, pulling out his pick-axe. Instantly, the cave is illuminated by a white floodlight. A group of GREENPEACE HIPPIE ACTIVISTS stand in the cave, CHAINED TOGETHER at the waist, startling the men into screams. MEAN GREEN (35, crooked glasses on a face that has launched a thousand craps) barks into a MINI BULLHORN that hangs around her neck. She charges towards Chief.

segments.content: Stop it right there! You will not
rape Mother Nature one more day!
Panicked, Chief drops his pick-axe and stumbles back.
In unison, the hippies start CHANTING.

dialogue.text: In unison, the hippies start CHANTING.

segments.content: Mother Nature is not a whore/Don't
dump in her any-more/Mother Nature
is not a whore/Don't dump in her any-
more...
A BEARDED CAMERAMAN with a huge KEY RING on his belt, films
the whole event. The three men are stopped in their tracks.
Take it easy! We have a permit!
(handing a document)
And we have an injunction from the
State to prevent any dumping in these
caverns! This is virgin land! The
aqueducts in these caves bring
drinking water to our families, and
its piping provides drainage for our
farms that enrich this barren land!
And it won't be tainted by waste of
any kind! Not now! Not ever!
Chief, shaken, confirms the injunction and hands it back.
He snaps his fingers, motioning to the barrel.

dialogue.text: He snaps his fingers, motioning to the barrel.

segments.content: Backing away, looking to Mean Green.

dialogue.text: Backing away, looking to Mean Green.

segments.content: How do you guys always know where
we're going?
(with a smirk)
Hastily, the men roll the barrel out of the cave.

character.name: I'll tell ya next time! NOW MOVE IT!

dialogue.text: Hastily, the men roll the barrel out of the cave.

segments.content: The hippies let out a spirited cheer. One pulls out a tambourine, drums the beat for KUM BI YA. The rest join in the victorious chant as they watch the three men hop in their truck and peel away.

character.name: Score one for the green team!!!

dialogue.text: The hippies let out a spirited cheer. One pulls out a tambourine, drums the beat for KUM BI YA. The rest join in the victorious chant as they watch the three men hop in their truck and peel away.

segments.content: Hey, man, that was righteous, but I

heading.subject: need a shot with the sign up.
heading.raw_text: need a shot with the sign up.

segments.content:
At the end of the human chain, an earthy woman, FUZZY, moves 

               to hang a GREENPEACE sign. Mean Green strokes the cave wall.
Fuzzy hammers the sign in, but hits too hard, causing a breach in the rock wall.

character.name: We saved you today, ol' gal.

dialogue.text: Fuzzy hammers the sign in, but hits too hard, causing a breach in the rock wall.

segments.content: Oh, fuck!
Sister, why do you always swing for
the fences?
(eyeing breach)
It's okay, but I... I think I see
something in there... something shiny.
Fuzzy puts her face up to the hole for a closer look. The
rest of the hippie-chain moves in closer.

CHOMP! A set of giant, ravenous teeth bite into Fuzzy's skull. Blood SPLATTERS on the hippies. Bearded Cameraman jumps to pull Fuzzy from the breach. Fuzzy's body is YANKED into the hole. The group tumbles forward. Mean Green tries to stop herself from sliding, but can't. One by one, the hippies are being dragged to their death. Ripping, tearing, and howling echoes off the walls. Bearded Cameraman stumbles back. Mean Green spots him.

character.name: Oh my, it looks like diamonds!

dialogue.text: CHOMP! A set of giant, ravenous teeth bite into Fuzzy's skull. Blood SPLATTERS on the hippies. Bearded Cameraman jumps to pull Fuzzy from the breach. Fuzzy's body is YANKED into the hole. The group tumbles forward. Mean Green tries to stop herself from sliding, but can't. One by one, the hippies are being dragged to their death. Ripping, tearing, and howling echoes off the walls. Bearded Cameraman stumbles back. Mean Green spots him.

segments.content: Bearded Camerman just stares at her in shock. He's missing both his arms. Mean Green lunges and grabs Chief's dropped pick-axe. She HAMMERS at the chain around her waist. Foot by foot, she's dragged closer. At the last second, she BREAKS the chain, popping herself free. She spins, running for safety. A guttural HOWL behind her fills the cavern. Mean Green sprints toward the cave opening. She's gonna make it. Only a few more feet. And then... JERK! Something grabs her neck and YANKS her back into the darkness. The whiplash sends her bloody BULLHORN flying into the light. As it lands, it lets out one last weak HONK...

heading.subject: SUPERIMPOSED: BASED ON A TRUE STORY
heading.raw_text: SUPERIMPOSED: BASED ON A TRUE STORY

segments.content: The title SHATTERS...

P.O.V. - We frantically EMERGE from the burning wreck... 

               RUN from the crash over desolate prairie land...

Neon light flashes UNITED NATIONS TAVERN. Laughing and music 

               emanates. Besides the bar, there's nothing around for miles.

               A 1985, pristine black Pontiac Trans-Am with a Golden Eagle 

               on the hood pulls up. The rear bumper sticker reads "MY OTHER

A weasel-like man with a fat belly and tank-top emerges from 

               the hot rod carrying a VELVET POOL CUE CASE. Freeze on him.

The rest of the parking lot is scattered with cars and pickup 

               trucks. Bozo lazily makes his way to the bar and pushes 

               through the front entrance --

Bozo passes a man dressed in a cheap suit and standing well 

               over six foot five with frazzled black hair and olive skin.

               Talking with a thick Greek accent, he pleads into a pay phone.
(into pay phone)
They took my laptop with my PowerPoint
presentation, my Blackberry, my
cell... And to top it off, my car
crapped out on the side of the road!
I'm not making the conference and I
have fourteen leads waiting for me.
You gotta help me out here. I'm not
kidding, I've have fourteen PRIMO
leads waiting in the lobby of the
Freeze on him. NAME: COACH AGE: 42 OCCUPATION: LIFE COACH & MOTIVATIONAL SPEAKER FUN FACT: OFTEN CALLED THE GREEK TONY ROBBINS LIFE EXPECTANCY: STAY FAR, FAR AWAY CLICK. The pay phone goes dead.

segments.content: Son of a --
(deep breath, soothing)

Hey...

You're late!

segments.content: I mean, we'd been together for so
long and then... bang! She drops me.
Since then, it's been like a damn
country song: she's gone, the car's
repossessed, and a father figure
made a pass at me. I'm not saying I
ever had it. But I have definitely
lost it.
(beat)
Now I haul this swill from armpit to
armpit. I used to be a model for
Coach has been eavesdropping on Beer Guy and approaches.

dialogue.text: Coach has been eavesdropping on Beer Guy and approaches.

segments.content: For what, may I ask?
Beer Guy then mimics throwing a sport coat over his shoulder and delivering his "model" cheese smile.

dialogue.text: Beer Guy then mimics throwing a sport coat over his shoulder and delivering his "model" cheese smile.

segments.content: You know, Chach, catching you at
this low point is pure serendipity.
Why is that?
Because I take the rubble of man and
build superstars. In my briefcase
here is a doorway to a self-help
sensation. Give me a minute, because
I'd like to buy you a drink and change
your life forever. I have a brochure --
Save it. We don't deal in pamphlets
'round here. We stick to chemistry.

Bartender puts a shot in front of Beer Guy. Behind him, a mounted DEER HEAD is prominently displayed. Freeze on him. NAME: BARTENDER AGE: 50 OCCUPATION: BARTENDER FUN FACT: SHOT 4 TIMES, STABBED 6 TIMES, BIT BY 1 SQUIRREL LIFE EXPECTANCY: READY TO WEAR With Coach stumped, Bartender turns to Beer Guy.

character.name: And his drinks are on me.

segments.content: Was that the last keg?
Yup, one keg of Beast for the
basement, then the truck's dry.
If you're stayin', move the truck,
boss gets pissed about you using
primo parking.

segments.content: ...the search for the missing
protesters will be further complicated
by the unstable conditions of these
deep tunnels. Thus far, no sign of
life has been detected, yet town
officials are still optimistic.
Newscaster spins and an ECLIPSE GRAPHIC appears on screen.
On a brighter note, or should I say
a darker note, tomorrow's solar
eclipse will bring out adults and
children alike for a citywide fair
of this metrological event. Stay
tuned for our man on the street to
take a closer look...

Beer Guy pulls the keg from the elevator and places it next

Listen, bud. I got a load ready to
move and your man's not here.
He's coming. Relax. And if he doesn't
show --

stay a teller and that if I did good
work and didn't mess up, I could
become an assistant manager within
three years.
(pause)
Can you believe that?

be an assistant manager at The Lake
Arrowhead Casino for knowing the
fuckin' alphabet to G! I'll be twenty
in three months...
The damning wedding band falls and bounces. As it rolls,
Tuffy, Trampy and Adulterer watch.
The ring stops, standing still on its side.
Trampy seethes as she chooses which obscenity to deliver.
Adulterer slides a wad of cash to Tuffy.

segments.content: Unless you people want to die you'll
do what I say and you'll do it fast!
You hold it right there, mister.
A storm of hell's coming down on
this place any minute!
Hero puts down the shotgun and moves towards Bartender.

dialogue.text: Hero puts down the shotgun and moves towards Bartender.

segments.content: I'm not armed now, just hear me out.
I'll drop you and not even think
about it!
Let me explain!
Hero reveals a drool-dripping, white, GRANDPA BEAST HEAD from the gunny sack and holds it out and for all to see.

dialogue.text: Hero reveals a drool-dripping, white, GRANDPA BEAST HEAD from the gunny sack and holds it out and for all to see.

segments.content: Take a good look and listen to me!
There's at least a four of these
things out there!
Grandpa Beast's head has large red eyeballs and a mouth full
of jagged, ivory white teeth. It is like an albino jackal
head with spiked hair.
I saw one of them tear up five men
like they were corn on the cob!
(off silence, shock)
I don't know what they are. I don't
know where they came from. All I do
know is that these fuckers are fast,
nasty, and hungry.
The bar stares at him, slack-jawed.
And they can fly. Not to mention
they got claws like Ginsu knifes and
more teeth than a chainsaw.

heading.subject: The Bartender lowers his shotgun slightly. Fast as a snake,
heading.raw_text: The Bartender lowers his shotgun slightly. Fast as a snake,

segments.content: Hero GRABS it. He notices the engraving, "THE JUDGE."
They're like goddamn blood hungry
biker tattoos come to life. They're
clocking us. Right now. And we have
to lock this bar down!
(moving around)
That means doors, windows, drains,
and basements. We have to do it fast!
Hero looks out the lone front window.
(looks to Belle)
You! Get on that phone. Call the
cops, National Guard, townies, whoever
kicks ass and get 'em out here.
Belle moves to a pay phone at the end of the bar.
Any questions?
Who are you?

A massive HIT slams into the doors from the outside sending Heroine SLIDING across the floor. Is it clear?!
Yeah.
Is there a gun pointing at you?

segments.content: My goddamn foot is gone! Who fuckin'

heading.subject: shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?
heading.raw_text: shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?

Her fella.
My husband...
Well, where's the sonuvabitch!?
He's dead.

(noticing destruction)

character.name: What the hell happened down here?!

segments.content: I didn't do it! It was fuckin'
monsters, asshole!
Jesus Christ on the cross... someone
make sense.
Easy. We're surrounded by something
the likes none of you have ever seen
before. Some kind of animals. Real
fast, volatile, predators. One went
through three of your patrons like
nothing.

heading.subject: So, your dead hubby shot me twice,
heading.raw_text: So, your dead hubby shot me twice,

segments.content: three of my customers have been eaten,
and there are angry creatures outside?
Huh?
(re: Bartender)

heading.subject: He shot you the other time.
heading.raw_text: He shot you the other time.

dialogue.text: Boss Man squints skeptically. Adulterer points to GRANDPA BEAST'S HEAD on the bar.

segments.content: Look at it!
Fan-fuckin-tastic.
My god... what is that?
That's one piece of four problems.
Please elaborate.
That head over there, that's the
oldest of the bunch, looked like the
Grandpa. We caught the little one,
Junior, in the cooler there. As we've
seen, what he lacks in size he more
than makes up for in speed.
And the rest of 'em?
Unfortunately, the worst of 'em are
still outside.
NOTE: As Heroine describes each beast, we see a slight glimpse
of their virtues, hidden mainly by shadows and fog.
The next one is taller, but all out
of proportion. Like a "teen beast."

TEEN BEAST has a big head and awkward body. He clumsily moves

He was spastic, clumsy, but deadly
just the same.

I just took the eye out of the mother.

Of all the friggin' bars to be stuck
in.
That's not it. Four are here, but
there's three others... which I can't
account for.

We need to lock this place down. Is

Never, ever, never. Never, ever,

Fuck no.
(into cell phone)
I have a signal! I have -- Diane?
Diane listen to me... get the kids
and get in the basement... do it

Trampy stares with grief in her eyes.
I'll explain later. Not now! I'm at
a bar... look... shut up! JUST SHUT

heading.raw_text: UP AND GET IN THE FUCKING BASEMENT,

Adulterer looks at the phone a bit dazed.
Okay. Okay. Look now, I gotta get
outta here! I gotta go! My wife...
See my wife is alone... She could be
in trouble. I GOTTA GO!
He moves towards the front door. Heroine moves into his path.
Adulterer, violently grabs Heroine to shove her away.

segments.content: Heroine nails Adulterer with THREE HITS to the chin, throat and chest, flipping him to the floor. She pulls a KNIFE from her belt buckle and has it under Adulterer's chin.

dialogue.text: Heroine nails Adulterer with THREE HITS to the chin, throat and chest, flipping him to the floor. She pulls a KNIFE from her belt buckle and has it under Adulterer's chin.

segments.content: You can risk your life, but not mine!
My daughter's no more than twenty
miles from here waiting for me. I
have just as much reason to leave
this place as you do. But I also
know that if they're here, then
they're not there yet.
Adulterer squirms.
You understand me?
Get the fuck off...
You understand me!?
Yes!
Now pull that tough boy shit again
and I'll slice you from neck to nuts!
Adulterer nods obediently. Heroine removes the knife from
his neck and plants it back into her buckle.
You can't keep me here. This is
bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is
fucking BULLSHIT!
We can't risk letting them in.
(trembling, pissed)

Adulterer takes his seat. He looks over at the half bald Trampy. She looks at him, hurt. At the bar, Bozo puts the TV back into place, he jiggles with some wires in the back, bringing back the picture.

a local broadcast.

And now, we head to our man on the
scene with a live look at tomorrow's
event in Red Mountain.
Heroine eagerly looks on, moving closer to the TV.

having some technical difficulties...
Heroine sinks in her skin.
Oh no.

dialogue.text: ON TV: A REPORTER, in an even worse suit, stands in a field with several people looking through telescopes.

segments.content: That's right, the crowds are lining
up early to witness tomorrow's
meteorological phenomenon.
Heroine sighs a gust of relief.
But always remember, don't look
straight into the sun because a
special filter is needed to avoid
damaging your cornea.
The Reporter beams.
And we're all looking forward to it
tomorrow. Back to you.
In the studio, the Newscaster smirks.
Roadie points to the TV.

Trampy is already dialing on the cell.

(into cell)

character.name: Hello? Yes, we're at the United --

power outage --
A Beast arm REACHES in and TEARS off Newscaster's jaw. The

cuts out, turning to static.
Trampy screams and DROPS the cell, SHATTERING on impact.
Heroine, tense, quells the rising panic.

dialogue.text: Heroine, tense, quells the rising panic.

segments.content: Keep it together! I came from the
east. That studio is south of here.
For all we know, north and west are
okay.
An associate of mine was coming in
from the north, ain't heard a word
from him in hours.
Tuffy looks up from a booth, clearing her throat.

dialogue.text: Tuffy looks up from a booth, clearing her throat.

dialogue.text: Heroine looks over, making eye contact.

in the kitchen, if we're on the same
page here.

dialogue.text: INT. BAR -- NIGHT The last board is hammered into place as the survivors back away from the now re-enforced bar.

segments.content: We'll it ain't pretty...
BAM-BAM-BAM! Junior Beast bangs around in the ice cooler.

dialogue.text: BAM-BAM-BAM! Junior Beast bangs around in the ice cooler.

segments.content: I think it's hungry again.
We have to kill it.
(to Boss Man)
Boss Man hobbles over to the cooler and aims his .38. Junior Beast goes wild, trying to get out.

Guts splatter. Bozo falls back unscathed. He catches his breath and looks to Tuffy. She is born again, seething.

dialogue.text: RAH! A tiny white arm fires out from the cooler GRABBING Bozo's leg. Bozo yelps. Moving quick, Tuffy grabs The Judge from Bartender and shoves the barrel into a hole. BLAM! bullets? How can we possibly fight
off the others?
Aim for their orifices. Eyes, ears
and mouth. From what I've seen, it's
their only weakness.
(looking at the corpse)
Looks like they're soft on the inside
like any other animal. Trick is to
get in there and do the damage.
Maybe we don't have to fight them.
Coach steps forward, poised to make the sale.

dialogue.text: Coach steps forward, poised to make the sale.

segments.content: Ladies and gentlemen, if I may have
your attention.
The bar skeptically eyes the large, sweaty Greek man.
We have to think outside the box
here. We don't need to fight them,
we need to scare them. Scare them
right back. This is a species stand-
off. We just need to show them we're
not vulnerable. That we're formidable.
How?
Bartender opens the cooler's lid and carefully pulls out Junior Beast with salad tongs. It falls to the floor with a SPLAT. Coach grabs a splintered broomstick.

dialogue.text: Bartender opens the cooler's lid and carefully pulls out Junior Beast with salad tongs. It falls to the floor with a SPLAT. Coach grabs a splintered broomstick.

segments.content: Showing superiority. The scent of
their dead may drive them away.
The whole bar moves to the side wall to see how the Beast
family will react. They look through SMALL HOLES, barely
able to see anything.
I don't see them.
Come on. Come onnnnnn.
Is there a call, or something?
See that you monkey fucks! That's
what you get when you mess with us!
Woman or man, I don't give a fuck!
Shit don't make me gay because you'll
be sucking my dick!

segments.content: If you don't mind me asking, how did
you run into these things?
More importantly, how did you run
away from these things?
Well, it all started about forty
hours ago...
The orange sun melts into the horizon.

Hero and his overweight friend TUBBS (35, hard living career 

               farm hand) laugh at a TV show while Heroine paces on the 

               telephone in the background.
(into phone)
So, how is staying with Grandma
working out? Ya know, if you stare
into her glasses, you can see what
cards she is holding. But I didn't
tell you that.

There's a home on the horizon with a big barn next to it.

               Shrieking and flapping grows in the distance.
Heroine starts to peek out of the window.
Mommy will pick you up tomorrow night,
okay baby?
The phone cuts out.
Heroine and Hero look at each other with concern. Hero looks out the window.

dialogue.text: Heroine and Hero look at each other with concern. Hero looks out the window.

dialogue.text: INT. BAR -- NIGHT Heroine has the group mesmerized.

segments.content: We barricaded ourselves in the cellar.
Then it was just listening. We heard
those things destroy an entire heard
of livestock. They just kept coming.
Closer and closer, consuming anything
in the way. Slashing, feeding and
licking the bones clean. Just when
we said our prayers, the first ray
of sun hit the house...

PLOP! A HORSE'S HEAD falls as Heroine and her companions 

               peek out from the damaged cellar door.
That first beam of sunlight drove
'em away. Somewhere. We called who
we could and then decided to run for
it. We didn't see a soul the whole
drive out. When the tank went dry,
we came upon a gas station to refill.

The sun is falling into the horizon. The traveler's CAMARO 

               pulls into a small gas station

Heroine goes up to the service window with Tubbs and looks 

               inside. Nobody. There is a slight BUZZING from inside.

               Hero hollers from the fuel pump by the car.
What's goin' on? The pumps are off.
She follows the buzzing sound to a corner of the room. There is a swarm of black flies crawling over half a STATION ATTENDANT'S gutted torso.

dialogue.text: She follows the buzzing sound to a corner of the room. There is a swarm of black flies crawling over half a STATION ATTENDANT'S gutted torso.

segments.content: They've been here!

dialogue.text: Glass shatters as Heroine reaches inside to turn on the pumps. INT. BAR -- NIGHT

segments.content: We had no time. All we knew was the
sun was dropping and we had to get
enough fuel to make it through the
night at 90 miles per hour...
Hero fills their Camaro.
Suck it down you metal bitch. Suck
it down.

Heroine and Tubbs hastily grabs food and drinks, ignoring 

               the cash register completely. The sun is setting.
Hero turns as a shrill HISSING comes from the shadows...

(to Heroine)
Hey, you lived on a farm, right?
Yeah.
Do you think they're gone? I haven't
heard anything for a while, maybe
they're gone.
Well, maybe they migrate?
As long as it's dark, they're around.
They hide, wait for you to drop your

How can you be so sure? You said

We learned fast.
We? We learned fast? You are all

Pocohantas, but I think someone else

Like me.

Spill it!

How 'bout you? Or do I have to get
rough?

Come on! Think back!
If I throw a stick, will you go away?

Earthquakes often cracked the piping

Cheese n' rice...

What I am saying is... there's a
distinct possibility that what we
are up against is the result of steady

day ago... something broke out.

Sit still, look less like a meal.

I can't get anybody. I don't even

Do you drive a short beer bus or
something? You go out there, you get
eaten. You stay in here, you get
eaten. Anyone comes to help, they

(re: Trampy)
Believe me, I'd love to save the day

(to Boss Man)
You said you had a short wave radio.

Upstairs.
Go for it. It's by the far wall.

(to Bozo)

Don't tell anyone I have a soft side.
(tiny smile)
SECOND FLOOR Bozo turns and points the gun around the room. He sees the CB. It is like an intercom with a cable running outside. He drops the shotgun and fidgets with the CB knobs.

dialogue.text: SECOND FLOOR Bozo turns and points the gun around the room. He sees the CB. It is like an intercom with a cable running outside. He drops the shotgun and fidgets with the CB knobs.

segments.content: Hello? Anyone there? We need help
out here at the United Nations Tavern.
Send guns, tanks, and all that shit.

All he gets is static. A faint GROWL is heard outside. OUTSIDE 

               THE DOOR Bartender hears the growl, his eyes grow wide.

Belle rubs her hands over her rounded ass and flicks her 

               tongue at Boss Man.
You wanna see, baby?
Hell yeah.
How much you got?
How much I got, what?
How much you got to see the show?
You don't understand, sweety. Daddy
doesn't pay. Daddy sees the show for
free. But you do get points for being
horny on a night like this.
She cringes and backs up a little.
What?
You can't expect a man to buy a car
without a test drive first, can you?
Um, hmm --
Now wiggle that sweet little ass
over here and sit on Daddy's face, I
wanna do some appraising.
Bozo barks into the CB.
Repeat. We need help. SOS. Calling
all cars! Calling all cars! We need
help at the United Nations Tav --
The CB is JERKED from Bozo's hands and slams into the wall.
Bozo aims the gun at the wall. Chewing sounds begin.

dialogue.text: Bozo aims the gun at the wall. Chewing sounds begin.

segments.content: He backs up to the door. OUTSIDE THE DOOR

dialogue.text: He backs up to the door. OUTSIDE THE DOOR

character.name: Okay, I'm ready to come out now!

dialogue.text: Bartender confidently turns the key. CLICK! It breaks off in the lock.

segments.content: SECOND FLOOR

dialogue.text: SECOND FLOOR

segments.content: "OH!?" WHAT IS "OH?" What does "oh"
mean?
Bozo knocks on the door hard.
Bartender looks to Coach.
SECOND FLOOR

dialogue.text: SECOND FLOOR

segments.content: A thunderous CRASH! Boards fly off the wall.
Belle, hearing the crash, jerks back from Boss Man.

CRASH! Sister Beast #1 and Sister Beast #2 punch through the tiny wall fan and GRAB Belle by the scalp. She is JERKED against the wall. She's slammed against it repeatedly and then -- RIP! Belle's skin is TORN from her head and torso. Boss Man jumps back.

dialogue.text: CRASH! Sister Beast #1 and Sister Beast #2 punch through the tiny wall fan and GRAB Belle by the scalp. She is JERKED against the wall. She's slammed against it repeatedly and then -- RIP! Belle's skin is TORN from her head and torso. Boss Man jumps back.

segments.content:
Boss Man shoves the bloody Belle back against the wall.

               Sister Beast #1 pokes her head inside the room, hissing.

Heroine and the others, just returning from the basement, 

               hear the mayhem from upstairs and the kitchen.

Coach fumbles desperately with the jammed lock, trying to 

               use his fingernails to turn the metal stump.

character.name: Great god, why do you damn me?!

dialogue.text: SECOND FLOOR Bozo kicks and punches the door.

Heroine charges up the staircase. Roadie rips the sawed-off 

               weapon from Beer Guy and runs for the kitchen.
The key broke off!
(to Coach)

Heroine rips the earring from Bartender's ear. He YELPS. She jams the backing into the lock. SMALL ROOM OFF KITCHEN Boss Man crawls for the door. Sister Beast #1 fires out a whip-like tongue and snags Boss Man's damaged foot. He howls in pain. Sister Beast #2 tongue-lasso's his other foot. OUTSIDE THE DOOR Heroine's picking fingers are bleeding from her effort.

Roadie kicks open the door and FIRES at the Sisters. They

Right behind Bozo, the boards fly off the portal window.

               Papa Beast flies at Bozo. Bozo spins and aimlessly FIRES his

heading.subject: shotgun, hitting Papa Beast directly in the groin.
heading.raw_text: shotgun, hitting Papa Beast directly in the groin.

segments.content:
The door flies open. Bozo is YANKED to safety just as Papa 

               STRIKES the closing door.

The patrons track the wild CRASHING and HIGH-PITCHED SHRIEKING 

               sounds of Papa Beast. He finally breaks out of the upstairs. 

               Beer Guy and Roadie carry Boss Man into the room as Coach, 

               Bartender, Heroine and the shaken Bozo creep down the stairs.  

               Bozo slowly takes a seat in his brother's lap.
I thought that was it for a second
there.
What happened?
I got Papa in the stones.
(beat)
He's neutered.
Whoa... good one...
Heroine glares at Boss Man.

character.name: That back room is sealed shut.

dialogue.text: Heroine glares at Boss Man.

segments.content: I told you to stay in the main room.
Coach eyes the group, this is his time to shine.

character.name: Yeah... I will. I will. Promise.

dialogue.text: Coach eyes the group, this is his time to shine.

segments.content: (rising, full of brawn)
If they can't reproduce anymore --
we are one step closer! A big step!
Now is the time to band together. We
need to rise up against these monsters
of the night! Those creatures are no
match for the human spirit! We can
do it! We just need to believe in
each other! In all of us! We need to
make a stand! Right here! Right now!
Long silence. Bozo stares.
Coach sits down, humbled.

dialogue.text: Coach sits down, humbled.

segments.content: We know what not to do. We must stay
focused and together. The beasts
will find a breach. We gotta find a
way out before they find a way in.
Let's run for the cars, cause mass
confusion.
The lot's too damn far, that's
surefire suicide.
The room is silent. Bartender motions to Boss Man, but he is
promptly shushed by Boss Man. Heroine notices.
(to Boss Man)
What?
What?
You know what.
I don't know shit.
(to Roadie)
You. What was that door downstairs?
Heroine glares at Roadie.

dialogue.text: Heroine glares at Roadie.

segments.content: Don't bullshit me.
Roadie nods, causing Boss Man to sigh.

dialogue.text: Roadie nods, causing Boss Man to sigh.

segments.content: It runs about a hundred yards and
spits out on the backside of that
hill down the way.
They clam up.

dialogue.text: They clam up.

segments.content: What's it for!?
Grass, man. I grow pot down there.
Does the tunnel spit out near a car?
It spits out behind the parking lot.
My truck is near, but it ain't nearly
big enough to haul the whole lot.

heading.subject: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?
heading.raw_text: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?

segments.content: Fully.
Four door?
Two.
How many can it hold?
Six.
Max?
Seven.
It's gonna fit thirteen.
Thirteen clowns wouldn't fit.
(with hand out)
Keys.
What're you planning?
Three of us go. Two to defend, one
to drive. We back up to the bar and
then tear ass out of here.
Sounds sketchy.
Let me make this clear; if we stay,
we die.
Boss Man reluctantly pulls out some keys that are on a string
around his neck.
Give 'em to me, I'm going.
You're trusting that con? He'll ditch
us and never look back.
Fuck you too.
Get in line!
Hey! I'm not trusting him either,
that's why I'm going with.
Coach stands forward.
"Courage is being scared to death,
but saddling up anyway."
(off blank stares)
The Duke. I will go.
This is it. They have this place
surrounded, but if we go under them
we might just make it.
This is a bottleneck waiting to
happen.
SMACK! Bozo SLAPS Coach's ass.
This one's great under pressure. I
wish you luck.
The rest of you prepare the weapons,
whatever you got left. 'Cause when
we crash through those walls, we're
bringin' death with us.
Heroine takes The Judge from Bartender and hands it to Coach.
No, I don't believe in guns.
This ain't time for a political
stance.
Coach takes the rusty machete from Beer Guy.
This doesn't run out of ammo.
Heroine, Roadie, and Coach move to the basement.

dialogue.text: Heroine, Roadie, and Coach move to the basement.

segments.content: The three look to Bozo, who offers a parting nod.

dialogue.text: The three look to Bozo, who offers a parting nod.

segments.content: When you get to that truck... drive
it like you stole it.
At a booth, Trampy re-bandages Adulterer's eye.
How does it feel?
Lousy.
You still have one left.
Yes, the silver lining.
It serves you right for cheating.
Spare me.
I figure it's karma. You wronged me
and you wronged your wife, so this
is karma biting you on the ass, or
in your case... in the eye.
Bozo moves close, surveying the bandage work.
Oh yeah?
It could be worse, you could be dead.
Then again, the climax is upon us.
(re: Trampy's hair)
Ya know, that's not a bad look on
you. Kinda 1985, but not bad. I'd
hook it up.
I wouldn't fuck you for practice.
Tease.
Leave her alone.
Hey, cyclops. Let's have a quiet
contest... starting now.
Bozo turns his attention back to Trampy.
Ya know, in situations of duress, I
have found that women are attracted
to my authority.

Heroine, Roadie, and Coach make their way through the 

               basement. Creeks and cracks with every step.
(to Heroine)
You handle yourself pretty well. You
a cop or a criminal?
Neither. Just a farmer.
Oh yeah? Then how do you do it?
I just think about my husband and
daughter... and the rest is easy.
The light casts a shadow of something BEHIND THE CURTAIN.
Roadie moves to open the curtain with his sawed-off barrel.
WHIP! The curtain slides. It's a dried animal hide on a hook. They all sigh. Roadie unblocks the tiny door. Heroine scans the room.

dialogue.text: WHIP! The curtain slides. It's a dried animal hide on a hook. They all sigh. Roadie unblocks the tiny door. Heroine scans the room.

segments.content: This place is creepy in the daytime,

Scared?
No. You?
Of course not. I fight monsters all
the time.
(gripping the door)
Roadie, Heroine raise their weapons.

dialogue.text: Roadie, Heroine raise their weapons.

bravery.

F-f-fuck you.
What the hell happened?
You okay?

segments.content: Stop trying to get people killed. It
is getting very old.

I need some shells.

right here, wait for sunrise, then
walk on out of here.

to get a whole lot worse before it

If all of you run for it, they won't
care about lil ol' me. They like the
food that moves...

               The group jumps back. Blood rockets out. His body is pureed 

               down the tiny hole.

segments.content: We're gonna die!
What the hell?!
Settle down!

And with that, the shouting and pounding stops. The group nervously shuffles around the tables. There's silence. Dead silence. Then, far is the distance, beyond the walls, a sound is heard. It's screaming. And it's approaching. Rapidly. The survivors maneuver to peek out the front walls.

character.name: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

segments.content: THUD! The first strike causes the men to HOWL.

The survivors shake in sickened silence. From beyond the 

               walls, they can hear high-pitched SCREAMS.

               THUD! THUD! THUD! With every strike, a splattering of blood 

               spits through the planks of wood.
That wall's coming down!
The entire group goes into motion.

dialogue.text: The entire group goes into motion.

segments.content: What's Plan B?
Just watch the floor and keep the
others safe!
THUD! THUD! THUD! With a final furious strike, a few wood
planks splinter. Papa Beast sticks in his head and hisses.

From the bar, Beer Guy, Tuffy, and Adulterer release the first peanut barrel. It's ablaze and sails straight for Papa Beast. BLAM! It explodes, bursting open the wall and knocking back Papa Beast. The wooden walls go up in flame. Para, on a side table, reaches out and grabs Boss Man's .38 from the floor. The second peanut barrel is released. It sails outside the breach, but it doesn't explode. Nevertheless, the Beasts stay far away. Teen Beast madly rips floor boards away, moving towards Para's table. Teen Beast bursts through the floor, knocking Para to the floor. Para crawls to his fallen wheelchair. Teen Beast spots him, moves in to feed. Para points his seat back at the scattered .38 bullets and flips the armrest switch. SNAP! The bullets jump to the power magnet. Para yanks one free, loads the pistol and turns just as Teen Beast strikes... POP! The shot hits Teen Beast in the eye, sending him back down the hole in the floor. Heroine and Bartender move in. When Teen Beast sticks his head out of the hole again, they thrust both their shotguns into each ear.

Tuffy raises the weapon again, staring down at the monster that killed her child, but Papa Beast gets an arm free to knock away her fatal blow. Bartender wrenches Papa Beast's arm with all his might. With her hair stuck in Papa Beast's claw, Tuffy is pulled face to face with the beast. She squirms as he chomps at her, but with no front teeth, he can't do immediate damage.

Tuffy reaches back and shoves her fist into Papa Beast's mouth, jamming it down his throat. He instantly gags, sucking for air. Papa Beast struggles to get free, but the others hold tight. Papa Beast's body begins to quiver from a lack of oxygen. His eyes widen, face to face with Tuffy.

With one last lunge, Papa Beast shakes, his life drifting 

               away. His eyes turn black as his body goes limp. Tuffy pulls 

               out her arm from his throat.
God...
Tuffy shakes her wet arm dry. As the group pulls away, Papa Beast is still pinned to the wall with the deer antlers dug into the wood. Heroine turns to Grandma and Grandpa, offering a hand.

I'm not leaving anyone behind.

Heroine lets out her breath, reaching around her neck for what is no longer there. The truck SKIDS to a halt. Tuffy jumps out.

character.name: I think we're in the clear --

to find other people.

I don't wanna go home alone... I
don't wanna see what might have...

am.

We're going to get my little girl.

dialogue.text: At a standstill, the group looks around for options. In the distance, the darkness of the eclipse rolls towards them. Adulterer reacts, grabbing Tuffy's machete and lunging for Charlie. The strike cuts the chain at her ankle. The manhole cover POPS off and a Beast claw sinks into Adulterer. The darkness covers the manhole. Momma Beast rises, hoisting Adulterer's blood dripping body from the ground.

segments.content: (gurgling blood)

Heroine scoops up her child, moving away from Momma Beast. Tuffy grabs them both, leading them back towards the store front. As Adulterer's blood flows, Momma Beast drags him towards her main prey. A blanket of darkness leads Momma Beast, overtaking the survivors. At the store front, Heroine pulls Charlie close.

dialogue.text: Heroine scoops up her child, moving away from Momma Beast. Tuffy grabs them both, leading them back towards the store front. As Adulterer's blood flows, Momma Beast drags him towards her main prey. A blanket of darkness leads Momma Beast, overtaking the survivors. At the store front, Heroine pulls Charlie close.

segments.content: (a whisper)
I love you...

heading.raw_text: EXT. IGA (GROCERY STORE) -- AN HOUR LATER

segments.content:
A string of ten WHITE VANS come to a halt in the dusty parking 

               lot. THE MAN IN TAN (45, buzz cut, leathery skin, cool) steps 

               from the lead van and surveys the ravaged small town.

               A swarm of men emerge from the other vehicles, all dressed 

               alike in work boots, gas masks and coveralls. They go into 

               action honing in on rubble with SENSORS and COUNTERS.
TECH (27, horn-rimmed glasses, all business) eyes a laptop.

dialogue.text: TECH (27, horn-rimmed glasses, all business) eyes a laptop.

segments.content: Twenty miles. Red Mountain,
surrounding farms, local TV studio.
How many picked up the broadcast?
The Man in Tan closes his eyes in thought.

character.name: We'll have figures within the hour.

dialogue.text: The Man in Tan closes his eyes in thought.

segments.content: Sir, what's the spin?
Tornado cluster.
This is the California high desert.
Get what you need to sell it.

The Man in Tan moves to a few men standing over a pool of blood and guts. Using the sensor equipment, the COMPANY MAN follows the blood trail that enters the grocery store. INT. IGA (GROCERY STORE) -- CONTINUOUS The place is torn to hell. Dust and soot hangs in the air. The men instinctively raise their high-powered rifles, letting the flashlights on the ends lead the way. They follow the trail of blood to a back FREEZER LOCKER. It's scratched, bashed and thrashed.

dialogue.text: The Man in Tan moves to a few men standing over a pool of blood and guts. Using the sensor equipment, the COMPANY MAN follows the blood trail that enters the grocery store. INT. IGA (GROCERY STORE) -- CONTINUOUS The place is torn to hell. Dust and soot hangs in the air. The men instinctively raise their high-powered rifles, letting the flashlights on the ends lead the way. They follow the trail of blood to a back FREEZER LOCKER. It's scratched, bashed and thrashed.

segments.content: Company Man #2 steps forward and uses a metal-cutting chainsaw to cut through the hinges. The door falls with a THUD. As the dust clears, Tuffy, Heroine and Charlie stare back at the men, huddled together in a defensive stance. The Man in Tan creaks his neck.

dialogue.text: Company Man #2 steps forward and uses a metal-cutting chainsaw to cut through the hinges. The door falls with a THUD. As the dust clears, Tuffy, Heroine and Charlie stare back at the men, huddled together in a defensive stance. The Man in Tan creaks his neck.

segments.content: Heroine, holding Charlie, lurches back.

dialogue.text: Heroine, holding Charlie, lurches back.

segments.content: You're not safe, she's still alive,
she'll be back...

The Man in Tan steps forward, guiding the group out. EXT. IGA (GROCERY STORE) -- MOMENTS LATER A bulky security truck pulls up. A DRIVER, holding a bloody rag to his nose, gets out and moves to the back door.

character.name: Relax. We know. We're the calvary.

dialogue.text: The Man in Tan steps forward, guiding the group out. EXT. IGA (GROCERY STORE) -- MOMENTS LATER A bulky security truck pulls up. A DRIVER, holding a bloody rag to his nose, gets out and moves to the back door.

segments.content: The Driver nods to the back of the truck, opening the door. Bozo lurches out, handcuffed and chained.

dialogue.text: The Driver nods to the back of the truck, opening the door. Bozo lurches out, handcuffed and chained.

segments.content: Get these cuffs off me! I'm a goddamn
hero for Christ's sake!
A shirtless, irate BOZO sits next to Grandpa and Grandma in
the back. He settles at the sight of the others.
G'morning.
Thanks for waitin' for me back there,
really fuckin' appreciate it!
Heroine covers her daughter's ears as the survivors are helped
into the truck. Tuffy sits, looking to Bozo.
How'd you survive?
I found a new weak spot on 'em, but
it damn ain't pretty getting to it.
Heroine, last in the truck, turns to the men.
Where are you taking us?
A trauma center. We have doctors
waiting.
(off Heroine's pause)
The door shuts on Heroine's concerned face. The Man in Tan locks eyes with the Driver.

dialogue.text: The door shuts on Heroine's concerned face. The Man in Tan locks eyes with the Driver.

segments.content: The Driver nods back. Sinister implication understood. The Man in Tan lights a cigarette as he watches the truck drive off. The truck's logo reads, "FARM-AID." He inhales. Freeze on him. NAME: THE MAN IN TAN AGE: 45 OCCUPATION: HE CAN'T TELL YOU PURPOSE: TO LAY GROUNDWORK FOR SEQUEL LIFE EXPECTANCY: PRETTY F-ING GOOD The Man in Tan exhales a gust of smoke.

character.name: Do it quick and spread the mess.
